an5.216:1.1: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks of intolerance.
an5.216:1.3: Most people find you unlikable and unlovable. You’re cruel and remorseful. You feel lost when you die. And when your body breaks up, after death, you’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
an5.216:1.4: These are the five drawbacks to intolerance.
an5.216:2.1: There are these five benefits of tolerance.
an5.216:2.3: Most people find you likable and lovable. You’re neither cruel nor remorseful. You don’t feel lost when you die. And when your body breaks up, after death, you’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
an5.216:2.4: These are the five benefits of tolerance.”
